main event: Several people in Twin Falls, Idaho reported sighting glow similar to a light bulb with triangular formation flying objects traveling at terrific speeds in the night sky on 19 August 1947.
interesting points: The objects were described as having a glow similar to regular electric lights and traveled at terrific speeds, some flying in triangular formation.
The report mentions the contradiction in the evidence as some objects were described as known while others were considered truly incandescent.
The overcast sky led to speculation about the possibility of signal or search lights being reflected from the cloud base ground.
The report evaluated various incidents and categorized them based on probability and existence of other explanations such as astronomical, balloons, rockets, flares, falling bodies, and more.
The report also noted a lack of clear evidence and hoaxed sightings, precluding a definitive explanation for certain incidents.
sighted object: glow similar to a light bulb with triangular formation flying objects
